info.name: AutoRename
info.summary: Automatically rename and move files based on configurable rules
info.description:
AutoRename is a Nextcloud app that renames and organizes newly added or moved files based on user-defined rules. By placing a `.rename.conf` file in a folder, users can specify regex-based patterns to rename or move files.
Renaming is handled by a background job that runs every few minutes, so changes may not be immediate.
Features: - ðŸ“ Define renaming rules using powerful regular expressions. - ðŸ“‚ Move files to subfolders specified in the new name (e.g., `subfolder/new_name`). - ðŸ“… Insert metadata like dates, EXIF data, or file modification times into filenames using [placeholders](https://github.com/powerflo/files_autorename/tree/main?tab=readme-ov-file#what-placeholders-can-i-use-in-the-replacement-string). - ðŸ” Extract [text from PDFs](https://github.com/powerflo/files_autorename/tree/main?tab=readme-ov-file#pdfPatternMatch) for custom filenames. - ðŸ”„ Transform filenames to [uppercase or lowercase](https://github.com/powerflo/files_autorename/tree/main?tab=readme-ov-file#how-do-i-rename-files-with-upperlowercase-changes).
Quick Start
1. Place a `.rename.conf` file in the desired folder. 2. Add a rule like this: ``` ^Invoice_(\d{4})_(\d{2})\.pdf$:Invoices/$1/$2/$0 ``` 3. Upload a matching file (e.g., `Invoice_2025_04.pdf`) â€” it will be renamed to `Invoices/2025/04/Invoice_2025_04.pdf` during the next background job run.
Check out the [full documentation on GitHub](https://github.com/powerflo/files_autorename).
